properties.name: Puerto Prado
properties.info: Located in the Marañón River basin, the Puerto Prado community is a community that works with chambira fiber and specializes in crafting jungle animals made from plant fiber and wire. They also create plates and baskets from plant fiber, dyed and woven with patterns typical of their Kukama Kukamiria ethnicity.

properties.name: Amazonas
properties.info: Located near Nauta, the Amazonas Community is dedicated to crafting Amazonian animals such as butterflies, among others, using wire and plant fibers.

properties.name: Manacamiri
properties.info: Located on the Nanay River, the Manacamiri community is dedicated to weaving with chambira fibers and specializes in jewelry and topa wood carving.

properties.name: Bora Community at Pebas Pucarquillo
properties.info: Located in the Ampiyacu River basin, the artisans of the Pebas Pucarquillo community are dedicated to making bags and shicras from chambira fiber, reflecting the traditional knowledge of the Bora ethnic group.

properties.name: Centro Fuerte
properties.info: Located on the Momón River, the Centro Fuerte community specializes in working with shiringa resin to produce rubber sheets using natural pigments.

properties.name: Santo Tomas
properties.info: Located in the southern part of the San Juan Bautista district,  these highly renowned artisans work, even at the regional level, with plant fibers, black ceramics, and wood carvings.

properties.name: Penal San Jacinto de Iquitos
properties.info: Previously known as Guayabamba, this penitentiary is located in the city of Iquitos. It offers vocational workshops in areas such as shoemaking, baking, carpentry, metalwork, and other manual trades, aiming to support the social and professional reintegration of a population that is often marginalized.
